results.title: Cartoon favourites. - Volume 2
results.brief_description: This tape includes 7 cartoons featuring some of your favourite cartoon characters. Stories include; “Rookie revue”; “Porky’s bear facts”; “Jasper and the haunted house”; “A Bout with a trout”; “Scotty finds a home”; “I wanna be a sailor”; and “Mutt and Jeff in westward whoa”. No other production details availble.

results.title: Cartoon classics of the 30's
results.brief_description: A historic collection of classic animated cartoons from the 1930s including two very famous and much loved characters, Felix the Cat (The Goose that laid the golden egg) and Daffy Duck. Entertaining family viewing but also a fascinating look back at animation styles and techniques of the era. NB: Quality of sound and color is variable.

results.title: Carthage rediscovered
results.brief_description: Carthage was once a maritime city open to the whole of the ancient world, today it is a suburb of Tunis but one has only to dig beneath the asphalt of any part of modern Carthage, to find extensive remains of the ancient city. Several missions are today making excavations in various areas in the hope of saving the stones and the mosaics.

results.title: Cars
results.creator_credit: John Lasseter, Darla Anderson, Pixar Animation Studios and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Hotshot race car Lightning McQueen (given voice by Owen Wilson) is living life in the fast lane until he hits a detour on his way to the most important race of his life. Stranded in Radiator Springs, a forgotten town on the old Route 66, he meets Sally, Mater, Doc Hudson (Paul Newman) and a variety of quirky characters who help him discover that there’s more to life than trophies and fame. Another hit animated feature from the studios of Pixar that will delight young and young-at-heart audiences alike. Also features the voices of Cheech Marin, Tom Hanks, Billy Crystal, John Goodman and many others. Original score composed and conducted by Randy Newman.

results.title: Carrousel
results.creator_credit: Bernard Longpre and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A visual poem, vivid, lyrical, as intriguing in its colour fantasy as in the beauty of its images. This is an escape from a merry-go-round of painted horses suddenly turned to flesh and blood, making a wild plunge for freedom. But these are horses of extraordinary colour - lime, mauve, bronze and gold - as if caught in some mysterious kaleidoscope of the dawn. A technical triumph, these unusual effects were achieved in the printing process. (Awards: Teheran, Colombo, Tel Aviv, Philadelphia)

results.title: Carrot nose
results.brief_description: Animated puppets are used to tell a story about some children who visit their grandmother at the farm where they build a snow man whose carrot nose is stolen by rabbits who need food in the wintertime.

results.title: Carrington
results.creator_credit: Christopher Hampton, John McGrath, Ronald Shedlo and Dora Productions
results.brief_description: Dora Carrington (Emma Thompson) devotes her life to writer Lytton Strachey (Jonathan Pryce) a tall, thin, bearded bachelor and member of London’s famed Bloomsbury artistic set. Even though their desire for each other was strong, their relationship was purely based on friendship, a bond that lives until the very end. This is one of the most unusual love stories you will ever see.

results.title: Carried away
results.creator_credit: Vonnie von Helmolt, Michael Scott and Destiny Deacon
results.brief_description: A combination of animation and live-action which celebrates the creative process. A stylised exercise using black and white photographs to represent reality and coloured overlays representing flights of fantasy. The artist learns by trial and error to take possession of his creative energy. Useful in the areas of art, media studies and as a stimulus to discussion in English classes.

results.title: Carrie (Special edition) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Brian De Palma, Paul Monash and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel by Stephen King, this film is the story of a young girl who is ostracized at school because of her ‘weird’ mother and upbringing. At the onset of puberty, Carrie White (played eerily by Sissy Spacek) discovers that she has special telekinetic powers that seem to become stronger when she is angered. She is finally pushed into a no return path of bloody vengeance on her cruel classmates. Piper Laurie contributes a memorable performance as the deranged Mrs. White, Carrie’s mother. Directed by a master of suspense and in the vein of Alfred Hitchcock, this film is an excellent example of tense and stylish horror. Cast also includes John Travolta, Amy Irving and Nancy Allen.

results.title: Carreras, Domingo, Pavarotti in Concert
results.brief_description: This program features Jose Carreras, Placido Domingo and Luciano Pavarotti in concert in Caracalla, Rome, with the Orchestras of Maggio Musicale Fiorenti and Teatro Dell’ Opera di Roma conducted by Zubin Mehta.
